intro: Colubrina mystacina, commonly known as the Florida colubrina, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and have a slightly waxy texture. Colubrina mystacina thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
